author: milos88
content:
Is https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-6800 the best documentation (should be used as a reference) regarding Verkle Trie and how it works?
Is there such documentation regarding generating proofs and verification?
I can't find single location where that is cleanly described. It feels like information is scattered across multiple posts/websites and it's unclear if they are still relevant (some were written quite some time ago). And let's say I don't care about correctness or fully understanding math and why it works, just how to implement everything from the start.
Or is recommendation to look at code of some existing implementations and try to understand how that works?

author: jsign
content:
To understand the Verkle Tree datastructure, I'd recommend: https://blog.ethereum.org/2021/12/02/verkle-tree-structure (and 6800, yes)
For a "spec" python impl, I'd recommend:  https://github.com/crate-crypto/verkle-trie-ref (I'd _definitely_ not recommend "porting" other clients implementations)
